unnormalised: Okay, so you're planning a wedding? Congrats! Setting the date can be a real headache, especially with Indian families, right? First, consult with your pandit for auspicious dates. You'll likely get a list spanning several months, maybe even a year. This is where the fun (read: chaos) begins! Then, check availability of key venues – like for instance, if you're eyeing that beautiful farm house on the outskirts of Delhi, book fast! Prime wedding season dates like Nov/Dec or Feb/Mar get snapped up really quickly.
normalised: Okay, so you are planning a wedding? Congratulations! Setting the date can be a real headache, especially with Indian families, right? First, consult with your pandit for auspicious dates. You will likely get a list spanning several months, maybe even a year. This is where the fun (read: chaos) begins! Then, check availability of key venues – like for instance, if you are eyeing that beautiful farm house on the outskirts of Delhi, book fast! Prime wedding season dates like November or December or February or March get snapped up really quickly.

unnormalised: Think about weather too! July/August in Mumbai means monsoon mayhem, and you don't want your guests wading through knee-deep water in their best sarees. Similarly, May in Delhi is basically a furnace. Consider a cooler month like Oct or even a winter wedding. Don't forget to factor in major festivals. You might not want to clash with Diwali (usually around late Oct/early Nov) or Holi (around March) as vendors and relatives might already have plans.

unnormalised: Finally, once you narrow down a few dates, poll your close family and friends. Even a simple WhatsApp poll can save you from major clashes. Aim to finalize at least 6-8 months in advance, if not more. It'll give you ample time to plan everything else, from caterers to outfits. And remember, ultimately, it's your day, so pick a date that makes *you* happy!
